circumstances: On approach to Kansas City-Charles B. Wheeler-Downtown Airport, the pilot encountered very bad weather conditions with low ceiling, fog and windshear. In a zero visibility, he failed to realize his altitude was too low when the airplane struck trees and crashed in flames few miles short of runway 19 threshold. The aircraft was destroyed upon impact and all three occupants were killed.
probable_cause:
Collision with trees on final approach due to improper IFR operation. The following contributing factors were reported: 
- Low ceiling, 
- Fog,
- Windshear, 
- Visibility at zero.
